job.title: Clerical Officer Grade III - Portlaoise
job.description:
We are now recruiting for Grade III Clerical Officers for our client in the education sector, based in Laois/Offaly. These are full-time position for an initial 3 - 12 month contract, location dependent:

THE ROLE:

  • Provide clerical support to the existing team
  • Data entry, administration, answering the phone, filing, typing reports/letters
  • Assisting with post
  • Setting up meetings (in-person or online via MS Teams) scheduling, sending invites & agendas, confirming delegates, taking minutes where required, issuing minutes
  • Processing of invoices / inputting invoices into system
  • Dealing with members of the public and staff (directing their query to the relevant person/department, assisting them in finding correct information on website/ giving them prospectuses etc.)
  • Uploading manual files to sharedrive/ cloud
  • Assisting the centre manager with the smooth running of the front desk

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous clerical / administration / receptionist experience is required
  • Must have excellent IT skills
  • Must have excellent data processing and attention to detail skills
  • Must have planning, organising and diary management skills
  • Capable of working in a team and on own initiative
  • Working knowledge of GDPR and understanding of general data protection guidelines

Working week: Monday-Friday
Hours of work: 9am-5pm / 8.30am-4.30pm (centre dependent)
Hours per week: 35
Rate of pay: €15.27 per hour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: €15.27 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Allpro Recruitment is a multi-award winning boutique recruitment agency with Midlands and Dublin branches.

We specialise in recruiting for Office Support, HR, Sales and Marketing, Finance, IT & Engineering, Construction, Warehouse & Manufacturing, Healthcare, Pharma and Public Jobs.

job.title: Setting Out Surveyor - Kildare
job.description:
SETTING OUT SURVEYOR, KILDARE, IRELAND

Our client, one of Ireland's top Data Centre and Life Sciences construction companies, is looking to hire a Setting Out Surveyor for it's Kildare based project. 

 

Key Responsibilities of the Role:

  • Stakeout of building elements as per construction drawings.
  • 3D laser scanning to capture field conditions.
  • Checking accuracy of install.
  • Tracking and reporting of set out work completed including set up reports.
  • Processing of survey data.
  • Completing required EHS paperwork.
  • All other duties associated with this role.

 

Essential Criteria for the Role:

  • Min. level 7 qualification in surveying, geomatics or civil engineering.
  • 2 – 3 years surveying experience.
  • Strong capability with the use of surveying equipment including total station and laser scanner.
  • Knowledge of scan post-processing software.
  • Verification reporting of install.
  • Ability to interpret construction drawings.
  • Good communication skills; liaise with construction management, engineering and site crews.
  • Good working knowledge of Autocad/ Navisworks.
job.companydescription:
Ardale Recruitment are an established agency specialising in Construction, Engineering and the Built Environment. Having over 20yrs experience in the industry, we have developed strong and real relationships only possible through proven results and longevity. Clients include Ireland's leading employers in Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, Building Services and Main Contracting.

We are constantly on the look out for candidates in:

  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering

  • Commercial, Estimating & Quantity Surveying
  • Procurement & Buying
  • Building Services Engineering

With client vacancies throughout Ireland and the UK & Europe, we can find you the ideal position to forward your career.

job.title: Dictaphone Typist / Medical Secretary
job.description:
Kilbeggan Medical Centre is currently recruiting for a Dictaphone Typist / Medical Secretary.

This role will primarily involve the typing up of letters dictated by clinical staff. Other duties and responsibilities will include:

  • Scheduling appointments
  • Dealing with patient queries face to face and all telephone queries
  • Responsible for taking payments, cashing up and balancing books
  • Supporting doctors and admin team with all admin and ad hoc duties
  • Office filing, scanning, updating Patient database and Retrieving patient charts

Experience Required:

  • Touch/Dictaphone typing skills are essential combined with IT skills.
  • Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Word and Outlook
  • Ability to multitask and work under pressure
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a busy administrative environment, ideally within the medical sector
  • Demonstrates experience of working as part of a very busy team in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and the drive for continuous improvement
job.category: Admin-Clerical, Executive Assistant, Health Care, Medical, Medical Secretary, Microsoft Office 365, Secretary
job.companydescription:
Kilbeggan Medical Centre was established in 1987 by Dr. Jerry O’Flynn and Dr. Marea O’Driscoll. They have been providing medical services to the community of Kilbeggan ever since. The Practice has grown significantly over the last number of years but we continue to pride ourselves on providing excellence in health care for all our patients in a warm, friendly and comprehensive manner. We strive to provide the best level of care that we would want for our families. It is our hope and intention that you receive high quality medical care in a personal setting and in an enjoyable manner.

We emphasise preventive medicine as well as the treatment of acute illnesses and the management of chronic diseases.

Our staff are highly trained and experienced. We care for our patients on every level to ensure that you get the very best medical care that anyone anywhere has to offer. We are here to provide you with the important, individualised care that each of you deserve and we will not stop short of anything but the very best!

We take pride in providing high quality same-day visits for urgent care, together with routine appointments for follow up and chronic disease management.

 

Kilbeggan Medical Centre
Mullingar Road, 
Aghamore, Kilbeggan, 
Co. Westmeath

Tel: (057) 933 2444

job.title: Fresh Food Manager
job.description:
Job Description

Main purpose of the role:

Ensure the store`s fresh food departments operate efficiently and effectively and provide our customers with the very best customer service and fresh food offering at all times.



The ideal candidate will have/be:

- 2 years` experience in a Fresh Food Department is desirable

- 1 years` experience in a Supervisor/Manager role is desirable

- Excellent communication skills

- Good delegation skills

- An understanding of how to achieve KPIs and targets

- Passion for fresh food.



Main duties:

- Actively live SuperValu brand-values i.e. Genuine, Passion for Food, Vibrant, Committed, Innovative and Imaginative

- Oversee and ensure the smooth running of the fresh departments by prioritising and delegating the workload appropriately

- Set, monitor and achieve sales targets with the team on gross profit margin, net margin, waste and other KPIs as agreed with Store Manager

- Control stocktaking and overheads as per fresh budget

- Foster good working relationships among the team

- Hold regular fresh food meetings and communicate relevant details and results to the team

- Manage employee performance, giving regular feedback, recognition and encouragement

- Deal with all customer queries efficiently, professionally and consistent with store policy

- Manage employee rostering and annual leave for fresh departments

- Ensure merchandising and presentation of the fresh department is of the highest standard at all times and in accordance with relevant store planograms and guidelines.
job.companydescription:
Buckley's SuperValu is a family run business based in the centre of Mullingar. The Buckley family and it's staff have been delivering excellent customer service and top quality fresh and local products to the people of Mullingar since 1949.

We have 3 x Supervalu Stores (Mullingar, Birr and Moate) and 1 x Centra Store (Mullingar) in the Midlands and are a continuous supporter of local jobs and the local community.

In conjuction with Musgrave Retail Partners Ireland, staff can also have the opportunity to pursue further education and training in various area's such as Apprenticeships in Butchery and Retail Supervision, Trainee Manager and Trainee Baker programmes, Certificates in Leadership and Management skills and Diploma and Degree programmes in Retail Management.

We offer Flexible working hours and aim to help our staff have a good work/life balance.

job.title: Toolmaker
job.description:
DECOTEK Automotive is based in the Irish midlands employing approximately 320 people in a highly skilled manufacturing environment. We design, develop and manufacture premium exterior trim components for the global automotive industry customers.

We are currently recruiting for a Toolmaker. This role will be full-time, shift work.

In this role as Toolmaker, you will be responsible for designing, building, and repairing tools used in manufacturing processes. The Toolmaker will be involved with collaborating with engineers, operators, and the production team to ensure that tools are properly designed, constructed, and maintained.

Principal Accountabilities:

·    To manufacture, repair and service all tools, jigs, and fixtures.

·    Set-up of tools in presses ranging from 50 to 500 ton.

·    Experienced with tooling which produces aluminium and stainless-steel products.

·    Ability to operate, set, and program CNC, PLC, and Robotic machines.

·    To monitor performance of setting, machines, and tool longevity.

·    Attending machine breakdowns to identify the root cause and solve the problem.

·    Using machinery such as lathes, presses, milling machines and grinders to cut and shape the tools.

·    Work effectively with all team members to assist in the continuous improvement of systems and processes and ensure best practice is consistently applied.

·    Monitoring the tools used on the manufacturing line to ensure efficient run rates and identify necessary repairs or possible improvements.

·    Using precision measurement instruments such as micro meter, gauges, and Vernier calipers to check the tool’s dimensions.

·    Experience in repair and maintenance of pneumatic special purpose equipment.

  • Operate and maintain production equipment and tools correctly whilst ensuring health and safety of self and others.
  • Carry out Preventative Maintenance on tooling as per PM Schedule.

·    Any other duties as assigned by the maintenance and toolroom manager

Skills and Experience:

·      Qualified Toolmaker to level 4

·      Post apprentice experience of 4 years is desirable

·      Experience in press tool maintenance and repair works.

·      Knowledge of set-up of tools in presses

·      CNC, PLC and Robotic programming a distinct advantage

·      Experience in the automotive industry is a distinct advantage

·      Proactive with ability to work with minimal supervision.

·      Flexible in approach to work

·      Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate well in English

Interested? What can Decotek offer you?

  • We provide 21.5 days of annual leave - plus your 10 statutory bank holidays
  • Compassionate Leave
  • Refer A Friend Scheme
  • Bike to Work Scheme
  • Employee Assistance Programme for you and your family, offering up to 8 free counselling sessions, and many more wellness benefits
  • Attendance Bonus
  • Health & Safety Bonus
  • Bi-Annual Events including Summer BBQ & Xmas Dinner

 

We'd love to hear from you. Please hit the link to apply, or get in touch via our careers page for more information on any of our open vacancies @ Decotek Automotive Ltd.

job.title: Quality System Specialist
job.description:
DECOTEK Automotive is based in the Irish midlands employing approximately 320 people in a highly skilled manufacturing environment. We design, develop and manufacture premium exterior trim components for the global automotive industry customers.

We are currently recruiting for a Quality System Specialist. This role will be full-time. Working hours will be Monday-Friday 08.00-16.30.

The Quality System Specialist will be responsible for the upkeep and continual development of Decotek’s Quality Management System (QMS). This will involve ensuring that an effective and efficient QMS is in place that complies with all relevant quality management systems, customer, and regulatory requirements.

 

Principal Accountabilities:

 

·      Ensure that the QMS is managed, developed and implemented appropriate to the activities of the company and all relevant requirements.

·      Liaise with all departments to ensure documentation in use complies with customer requirements, regulatory and external quality standards and is ‘audit ready’ at all times.

·      Liaise with external auditors to schedule audits and monitor the completion of corrective actions in a timely manner to ensure certification is maintained.

·      Develop, implement and update QMS policies, procedures and templates and circulate as required. Maintain document control on all documentation.

·      Ensure the latest versions of documents are available where needed and that users have the correct access.

·      Ensure previous versions of the QMS and external standards are saved correctly and retrievable if required.

·      Monitor and maintain the retention times for document storage to ensure that the documentation is retained in a suitable manner to allow retrieval if required.

·      Ensure that any changes to system requirements are implemented competently, in a timely manner and that all affected parties are made aware of any changes.

·      Provide training and support to employees on document management procedures and QMS requirements.

·      Serve as a resource for internal stakeholders seeking guidance on document-related matters.

·      Review documents completed by other departments and update /correct where necessary.

·      Actively participate in and implement continuous improvement projects related to the QMS.

·      Support the Internal Audit system and the retrieval of documentation as required.

·      Stay informed about industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices related to document management in the relevant portals.

 

Skills and Experience:

 

·      Third level qualification in related field (Quality Management, Engineering, Manufacturing)

·      Minimum of 3 years of experience in quality management systems development and implementation.

·      Strong knowledge of regulatory requirements and standards such as ISO 9001 and IATF 16949.

·      Proficiency in all programs of Microsoft Office software, especially Word, Excel and Outlook.

·      Understanding of document control systems such as Docsvault or a similar software system.

·      Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

·      Excellent attention to detail to ensure documents are accurate and created to specifications.

·      Industry-specific technical knowledge, including understanding of industry terms, policies, and processes.

·      Experience with auditing and root cause analysis techniques is desirable.

·      Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

·      Flexible and open to change and development within this role.

Interested? What can Decotek offer you?

  • We provide 21.5 days of annual leave - plus your 10 statutory bank holidays
  • Compassionate Leave
  • Refer A Friend Scheme
  • Bike to Work Scheme
  • Employee Assistance Programme for you and your family, offering up to 8 free counselling sessions, and many more wellness benefits
  • Attendance Bonus
  • Health & Safety Bonus
  • Bi-Annual Events including Summer BBQ & Xmas Dinner
  • Competitive Pay Rates

 

We'd love to hear from you. Please hit the link to apply, or get in touch via our careers page for more information on any of our open vacancies @ Decotek Automotive Ltd

job.title: Qualified Motor Technician
job.description:
Qualified Motor Technician position available for immediate start at Sleator Kia and Midland Suzuki Mullingar.

 This position is for all brands with the progression to Expert - Master status in Kia Academy and Suzuki Training to Level 4 EV accreditation

Excellent re-numeration package calculated on ability and experience. 

 

Requirements

  • Be able to work off your own initiative and be self-motivating
  • Attention to detail to ensure quality is consistently delivered
  • Present a professional image at all times both internally and externally
  • Good communicator and a team player
  • A desire to self-develop and participate in the manufacturer training program
  • Work independently in a busy environment, their managing own time, and workflow effectively and efficiently
  • Full driving license
  • The current main dealer experiences an advantage
  • EV and Hybrid Certification also an advantage

 

 

Key Duties & Responsibilities

  • Diagnose, repair, and service vehicles to the highest standard adhering to the manufacturer’s guidelines
  • Have a full understanding of the latest technologies introduced, and how to diagnose and repair faults
  • Completion of all relevant documentation in line with warranty and dealership requirements
job.companydescription:
Sleator Kia is delighted to be part of an exciting progressive brand with state of the art technologies developed worldwide. you too can be part of the progression towards electric vehicles and join a team that has one eye on the future of motoring.

We strive for customer excellence and continue to build a strong dedicated team.

job.title: Kia Master Technician
job.description:
Sleator Kia Mullingar is looking for Certified Master Technician

Sleator is looking for Certified Master Technicians to join their industry leading Service Team! Enjoy excellent pay and performance incentives at a dealership where your skills will be recognized and rewarded! Be part of an expanding team of skilled technicians.

This is a specific high paid on site role within commuting distance from Dublin/ longford /Tullamore/ Athlone/ Navan/ Maynooth and surrounding areas.


Job Responsibilities:

  • Perform work outlined on maintenance and repair orders to ensure customer satisfaction
  • Diagnose the cause of any malfunction and repair in a timely manner
  • Provide labour and time estimates for additional automotive repairs
  • Able to explain mechanical problems and needed repairs to Service Advisors and vehicle owners in a non-technical manner
  • Continuously learn new technical information and techniques in formal training sessions in order to stay in line with rapidly changing electric car technology
  • Ability to perform all EV battery installations and repair with level 4 accreditation in eV repairs

Job Requirements

  • Past Kia /Hyundai Experience required, Kia Academy training Certification is required
  • certified EV training to level4 standards 
  • Team oriented, flexible and focused on maintaining a high level of customer service
  • Must have a valid driver's license
  • Fluent English speaking.

Benefits:

  • Paid Vacation and Personal Time
  • Paid Training days.
  • Employee purchase programs
  • Company car program
  • Health insurance plan
  • Team bonus
job.companydescription:
Sleator Kia is delighted to be part of an exciting progressive brand with state of the art technologies developed worldwide. you too can be part of the progression towards electric vehicles and join a team that has one eye on the future of motoring.

job.title: Car Valetor
job.description:
Job description

Sleator.ie

Franchised dealers for Kia and Suzuki in the midlands have an opening for a Car Valetor in Mullingar
Key duties & Responsibilities.

  • Wash and valet cars to the highest industry standards.
  • Be responsible for the condition and presentation of all units.
  • Yard management and Showroom display.
  • Photograph finished cars and upload to websites and Sales team
  • Inspecting cars prior to hand-over and liaising with sales.
  • Be responsible for keeping our sales pitch/yard/displays up to standard.
  • Ensure all damages are reported to management to carry out repairs.
  • Liaise with sales to plan and prioritize jobs.
  • Carry out valeting/interior detailing; shampooing seats/carpets/mats/roof-liners/etc, cleaning and detailing vents/glass/plastics/etc.
  • Carry out paint correction/machine polishing to remove imperfections/scratches/etc.
  • Carry out touch ups (wet sanding and general knowledge of paints a bonus).
  • Dressing/protection of all interiors and exteriors, using products such as coatings/waxes/etc.
  • Providing feedback to management on what products/tools/supplies are needed to replenish, etc.
  • Ensure valeting bay is clean and tidy.
  • Keep work areas clean and tidy, organised, and safe from hazards in accordance with health and safety guidelines.
  • Successful candidate will also be expected to carry out a general operative role when needed (attending NCT's/VRT's/driving cars to and from suppliers/deliveries/etc.

The successful candidate will ideally:  Have a minimum of 3 years previous valeting/detailing experience. Hold a full, clean, and current driving licence. Take 100% pride in their work and have a meticulous attention to detail. Be honest, trustworthy, reliable, and conscientious. Have the ability to work under time pressure and meet agreed deadlines. Exhibit good communication skills. Be flexible in their approach to work. .

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

We value and thank you for your enquiry. We are committed to an honest appraisal, therefore if we have not contacted you within 5 days of your application, we have determined that your experience and skills do not match the very specific criteria required.

Skills:
Car valetor

Attention to detail

Excellent english

3 years detailing experience

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From €30,000.00 per year

job.title: Stores Controller
job.description:
We’re a thriving team passionate about working together to deliver excellence, all in a natural forest environment.

Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland, 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round.

STORES CONTROLLER | Circa €37,100 Per annum

Reporting to the Food, Beverage and Retail Manager, the Stores Controller is a key post, responsible for; supplier ordering, goods received, on site delivery and cost management of the Central Stores function for the Food and Beverage Division.  You will have commercial accountability for purchasing up to €1m per annum of products and operational responsibility for delivering to 10 outlets internally with the support of a small team.

Duties will include:

Ensuring the delivery of our service standards through proactive management and support of the junior management teams

Ensuring all divisional operating procedures are followed and taking an active part with all internal and external audits and compliance.

Delivery of financial KPIs through effective ordering, stock management, wastage and payroll controls

ABOUT YOU

The ideal candidate will have previous experience managing a busy, multi operational warehouse/stores environment and will be able to demonstrate good financial awareness and possess computer literacy and analytic skills. Good verbal and written communication skills are also required and you should be able to demonstrate excellent people management skills, along with a clear ability to lead and motivate a team. A full driving licence will be required to undertake this role as you will be required to drive company vehicles around site.

HOURS OF WORK

You will be contracted to work 150 hours per 4-week period on a flexible basis. This means that your days and hours of work could vary each week but you will always receive your contracted hours per period.

Your working hours will include days, evenings, weekends, public / bank holidays and during Christmas and/or New Year on a rota basis, with a premium rate of pay for hours worked on a Sunday.

THE BENEFITS

Center Parcs is a fantastic place to work and the benefits are as impressive as they are unique. Here are just a few:

  • Colleague Bonus Scheme
  • Pension Scheme with Life Assurance
  • Colleague Recognition and Reward Scheme – offering a choice of Center Parcs and High Street vouchers
  • Free use of our leisure facilities
  • Discounted Center Parcs breaks
  • 20% discount in our restaurant and retail outlets
  • Access to Perks at Work Portal - offering a wide range of retail and leisure discounts
  • An Employee Assistance Program - providing support on financial, health and legal matters
  • Excellent opportunities for career development and progression with the opportunity to gain externally recognised qualifications

If this sounds like your ideal job, then we’d love to see your application.
job.companydescription:
Imagine being greeted by playful squirrels and a good morning ‘quack!’ by the local ducks on your commute into work. Imagine having a workplace that’s up to 400 acres of beautiful forest. Imagine being part of a family where you love coming to work and helping to make special memories. At Center Parcs, you can have all that and more.

Whether you’re a Housekeeper, Chef, Lifeguard or Electrician, everyone is part of the same Center Parcs family, and no two days are the same. If you are looking for a unique place to work with endless opportunities and famously good staff perks, visit our vacancies page and apply to work at Center Parcs.

job.title: IT Support Technician
job.description:
We’re a thriving team passionate about working together to deliver excellence, all in a natural forest environment.

Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland, 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round.

IT SUPPORT TECHNICIAN | Circa €41,400 per annum

In this role, you will be the ‘Face of IT’, responsible for delivering first class IT support to both our guests and colleagues.

You will ensure that all IT related issues and policies are addressed in a professional manner and through the appropriate channels.  The successful candidate will have a strong technical background, having previous experience of operating in a 2nd line support role, balanced with exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, and an ability to communicate at all levels throughout the business.

Other responsibilities will include providing high-level support for our guest and business Wi-Fi infrastructure; building desktops and laptops, working alongside the Head Office team, configuration and ongoing support for mobile devices, back-up management and picking up and resolving success and failure notifications.

The successful candidate will be required to participate in the IT Service Delivery support rota, providing out of hours cover and support to both Head Office and the UK Villages.

ABOUT YOU

Essential requirements:

  • Proven and strong record in 2nd line IT Support environment
  • Excellent communicator with a Customer Focused approach
  • Thorough understanding of ICT, including ; PC’s, Laptops, tablet devices, IP Telephony, PC Applications, EPOS Handhelds, Infrastructure Wi-Fi
  • Ability to extensively troubleshoot and document knowledge and processes
  • A full driving licence
  • Located within driving distance of the site – for ‘call-out’ duties

Desirable requirements:

  • Articulate and methodical approach to IT Support
  • Industry recognised Service Desk, Network, CompTIA or Microsoft qualifications
  • Experience of Desktop management and Desktop deployment tools
  • Experience of a tiered IT support service with first, second and third line

HOURS OF WORK

You will be contracted to work 160 hours per 4-week period on a flexible basis. This means that your hours and days of work could vary each week, but you will always receive at least your contracted hours each period.

As our village is open 365 days of the year, your working hours may include working bank holidays and during Christmas and/or New Year on a rota basis.

THE BENEFITS

Center Parcs is a fantastic place to work and the benefits are as impressive as they are unique. Here are just a few:

  • Colleague Bonus Scheme
  • Pension Scheme with Life Assurance
  • Colleague Recognition and Reward Scheme – offering a choice of Center Parcs and High Street vouchers
  • Free use of our leisure facilities
  • Discounted Center Parcs breaks
  • 20% discount in our restaurant and retail outlets
  • Access to Perks at Work Portal - offering a wide range of retail and leisure discounts
  • An Employee Assistance Program - providing support on financial, health and legal matters
  • Excellent opportunities for career development and progression with the opportunity to gain externally recognised qualifications
  • Comprehensive ICT training and certification routes for careers progression

If this sounds like your ideal job, then we’d love to see your application.

job.title: Qualified and Trainee Lifeguards
job.description:
We’re a thriving team passionate about working together to deliver excellence, all in a natural forest environment.

Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland, 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round.

WHY JOIN US.

You probably won’t find another swimming pool like ours in Ireland.  Our Subtropical Swimming Paradise is the focal point of every village. We have slides, whirlpools, splash areas for our younger guests, underwater activities to enjoy and cabanas to kick back and relax in. Our Lifeguards are present and involved in each area and activity, so your job will be incredibly diverse. 

We’re a team. Imagine working in an environment where support and wellbeing are second nature. Our team of Lifeguards, Team Leaders and Managers extend their experience and knowledge as often as they can, so we can all work together to achieve guest excellence.

QUALIFIED & TRAINEE LIFEGUARDS | €14.14 Per Hour

Working in a large team, you’ll be allocated general cleaning and testing duties to make sure the pool is safe for guests. You’ll be on rotation with other Lifeguards, monitoring various activities and attractions on a 30 minute cycle, as well as supervising guest leisure activities. At each of the lifeguard stations you’ll be expected to maintain guest safety, whilst ensuring they are happy in their environment.

Trainee candidates will be required to attend an NPLQ course and an offer of employment will be subject to passing the course and a successful interview. Please note that the course will be full-time hours for 5 days and include classroom sessions on the responsibilities of being a Lifeguard, how to observe our pool guests, how to rescue those in need and how to administer first aid and CPR.

Candidates must successfully pass a swim test in order to progress to interview stage

Upon successful completion of this course, you will gain a recognised lifeguard qualification that lasts two years from the date of assessment.

Due to the sensitive nature of this role the successful applicants will be required to undergo Garda Vetting.  This disclosure, together with other selection information, will need to be satisfactory to the Company for employment to commence.

ABOUT YOU

You’ll be someone who is naturally cheerful, friendly and approachable, and who works well in a large team. Each day will bring different duties around the pool, from pool, slide and water safety checks, through to cleaning, tidying and generally being on hand to provide a great service to our guests. This means that you’ll need to be the sort of person who loves helping others and thinks nothing of going over and beyond expectations.

Essential requirements:

  • IWS/RLSS Pool Lifeguard Qualification (training will be provided)
  • Excellent interpersonal, observational and communication skills
  • Able to work in accordance with policies and procedures
  • Candidates must successfully pass a swim test in order to progress to interview stage

HOURS OF WORK

You will be contracted to work 150 hours per 4-week period on a flexible basis. This means that your days and hours of work could vary each week but you will always receive your contracted hours per period.

Your working hours will include days, evenings, weekends, public / bank holidays and during Christmas and/or New Year on a rota basis, with a premium rate of pay for hours worked on a Sunday.

THE BENEFITS

We have a great range of standard benefits which all our employees are entitled to but as a Lifeguard, you’ll also enjoy a fantastic team environment where rewards and recognition go hand in hand. Training is paramount to ensuring safety so you can expect us to continually support you in achieving standards, as well as helping you to progress your personal career in leisure.

Center Parcs is a fantastic place to work and the benefits are as impressive as they are unique. Here are just a few:

  • Colleague Bonus Scheme
  • Pension Scheme with Life Assurance
  • Colleague Recognition and Reward Scheme – offering a choice of Center Parcs and High Street vouchers
  • Free use of our leisure facilities
  • Discounted Center Parcs breaks
  • 20% discount in our restaurant and retail outlets
  • An Employee Assistance Program - providing support on financial, health and legal matters
  • Excellent opportunities for career development and progression with the opportunity to gain externally recognised qualifications

If this sounds like your ideal job, then we’d love to see your application.

job.title: Spa Beauty Therapist
job.description:
Aqua Sana is a unique, multi-award-winning spa in the heart of the forest, with six locations across the UK and Ireland. Recent awards include ‘Best Destination Spa’, ‘Best Day Spa’ and ‘National Spa of the Year’.

SPA BEAUTY THERAPIST | €15.07 per hour plus commission

Discover extraordinary benefits

  • Enjoy heavily discounted Center Parcs breaks, free use of our spa facilities, opportunities to earn retail commission, free day passes for you and your family, and discounts in our restaurants and retail outlets.

Stay up to date with new trends and skills

  • We offer in-house training on beauty brand treatments, along with wellness and holistic therapies. We even create our own treatments, drawing upon the experience and skills of our Therapist family.

Career progression opportunities

  • Alongside our in-house training and development of new skills, you will also have the opportunity to gain externally recognised qualifications.

A unique working environment

  • Our tranquil spa is tucked away in the heart of the forest

Work with like-minded people

  • A friendly and welcoming team who are passionate about wellbeing and beauty, and keen to share their knowledge and skills

Aqua Sana Spa is proud to work with some of the most luxurious skincare brands available on the market, namely Elemis and VOYA. From massages to manicures, facials to full body treatments, you’ll love providing our range of holistic, therapeutic, express and beauty treatments. You will also assist our guests to select the perfect items from our comprehensive retail offering.

About You

We have six spa locations across UK and Ireland. Each one offers something a little different, with different spa experiences, layouts and surroundings, but one thing they have in common is the people. Making our guests feel amazing is at the heart of what we do.

When you step through our doors, we want you to:

  • Have a desire to deliver consistently high standards
  • Be able to prepare well and keep to a timetable
  • Be naturally cheerful, friendly and approachable
  • Have excellent communication skills.

Essential qualifications

  • Level 6 Beauty Therapy or equivalent qualification
  • Level 3 Diploma in Body Massage or equivalent

Desirable requirements

  • Reflexology qualification
  • Previous experience working within a salon or spa environment
  • Product training on Elemis, OPI, Mii Makeup

Due to the sensitive nature of this role the successful applicant will be required to apply for Garda Vetting. This disclosure, together with other selection information, will need to be satisfactory to the Company for employment to commence.

HOURS OF WORK

You will be contracted to work 144 hours per 4-week period on a flexible basis. This means that your days and hours of work could vary each week but you will always receive your contracted hours per period.

Your working hours will include days, evenings, weekends, public / bank holidays and during Christmas and/or New Year on a rota basis, with a premium rate of pay for hours worked on a Sunday.

REWARDS AND BENEFITS

Your training at Aqua Sana Spa doesn’t stop with your induction; it’s only the beginning. We offer regular in-house training courses so you can keep ahead of new treatments and wellness trends, and your individual development will be supported every step of the way.

Health and wellbeing are central to our ethos, so we actively encourage our staff to use the spa facilities free of charge because a relaxed and happy team are an amazing asset for us and our guests. And as the work can be quite physical, we restrict massage to 4.5 hours a day.

As well as a free uniform, your retail commission, huge discounts off breaks at Center Parcs, discounts in our retail outlets and restaurants and free day passes for you and your friends or family, our other benefits include:

  • Colleague Bonus Scheme
  • Colleague Recognition and Reward Scheme – offering a choice of Center Parcs and High Street vouchers
  • Access to Perks at Work Portal - offering a wide range of retail and leisure discounts
  • An Employee Assistance Program - providing support on financial, health and legal matters
  • Pension Scheme with Life Assurance
  • Excellent opportunities for career development and progression with the opportunity to gain externally recognised qualifications

If this sounds like your ideal job, then we’d love to see your application.

Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland, 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round.

All colleagues working in our restaurants, cafés and bars will benefit from the discretionary service charge we add to bills. The majority of our guests are happy to reward our colleagues for their excellent service.

At Longford Forest, the Food and Beverage department employs around 300 team members across 10 different restaurants, cafés and bars, as well as a production kitchen. job.description:
We’re a thriving team passionate about working together to deliver excellence, all in a natural forest environment.

Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland, 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round.

ABOUT THE ROLE

From a big platter of bacon sandwiches to a quick Mediterranean flatbread or our mouth-watering rotisserie chicken, you’ll find plenty of tasty choice on the Sports Café menu. We’re open from breakfast through to midnight and this is a busy, popular venue with the big games being streamed live onto our screens.

We’re now looking for a highly motivated Assistant Restaurant Manager to join us, to develop the team and drive the business forward.

ASSISTANT RESTAURANT MANAGER | Circa €32,000 per annum

All colleagues working in our restaurants, cafés and bars will benefit from the discretionary service charge we add to bills. The majority of our guests are happy to reward our colleagues for their excellent service.

Great service is infectious. That’s why we need you share your unique hospitality style and experience with the front of house team, ensuring that the restaurant fully reflects guest choice and expectations.

Speed, efficiency and effectiveness across all areas of the restaurant will be the order of the day. You’ll be supporting a brilliant management team to take on daily operational challenges by effectively monitoring and coaching people on all aspects of service. With your help, our team members and supervisors will always be in high spirits and prepared be as helpful as possible to colleagues and guests.

job.title: Document & Quality/Stock Controller
job.description:
Stock Controller Incorporating Safety Representative Duties

A Stock Controller tracks stock levels and ensures that the supplies of raw materials & finished goods are sufficient to current stands, regulations, and the demand of customers. Your primary duties include checking stock levels, ordering additional stock and updating stock records. The Company Policy is to ensure that stock control is monitored accordingly to ensure maximum quality in a profitable manner in a safe environment.

Stock Controller responsibilities include but not limited to:

 

o   Reporting to Business Development Manager & Production Manager

 

o   Checking Stock levels regularly and communicating with Production Manager/Business Development Manager regularly to ensure adequate supply of all stock both raw materials & finished goods.

o   Updating stock levels and ensuring accurate records are maintained.

 

o   Liaising with other Team Leaders and Management daily to ensure efficient production of priority Stock requirement in line with order schedule.

o   Report to management on issues with finished goods quality or supply.

 

o   Identify issues in efficiency of stock control and suggest improvements & implement where necessary.

 

o   Place orders as required by Production/Management for all Raw Materials required to complete finished product.

o   Preparing and loading off any Courier collections in line with dispatch schedule.

 

Document Controller Duties include but not limited to:

 

o   Reporting to the Production Manger

 

o   Carrying out safety risks assessments daily and directing Production Manager of any hazards.

 

o   Liaising with Production Manager to ensure the Safety Management System is updated daily

 

o   Preparing and filing reports for accidents and other safety breaches & Recording in Company ‘Serious Incident Log Book’.

 

o   Ensuring all Safety equipment including PPE is used accordingly.

o   Ensure all Fire equipment and Exits are inspected on a daily basis

o   Maintain adequate stock of PPE, First Aid kits and tracking distribution of same.

o   Dealing with Minor incidents onsite in line with First Aid safety training received, and alerting Emergency services in the event of serious incident.

 

Other Daily Tasks include but not Limited to:

o   Updating stock accurately on Finished goods board daily and highlighting any discrepancies.

 

o   Co-ordinate with Production Manager/Team Leaders on priority stock requirement for dispatch daily.

o   Spot check finished goods, brand & label accordingly and report any quality issues to production manager.

 

o   Order raw materials as required including raw aggregates, admixtures, cement, steel.

 

o   Maintain, Store and organise deliveries as required.

 

o   Distribute PPE Gear to production staff and record accordingly.

 

o   Perform regular Safety Checks and record daily in line with Company safety Policy.

                

Qualifications:

All training will be provided
job.category: Admin-Clerical, Construction, Health & Safety, Manufacturing, Parts Management, Production, QA - Quality Control, Supply Chain, Training

job.title: Experienced Mortgage Advisor
job.description:
Excellent opportunity for a suitably experienced Mortgage Packager/Advisor to join our expanding Award winning Mortgage Brokerage Team in Mullingar with the flexibility of remote working and visiting our Mullingar office 2 - 3 days a week.

The successful candidate will play a key role within our Team and ideally will currently be working in either a client facing role or mortgage packaging role in either a Brokerage or Retail Bank environment.

  • Death in Service Benefits (4 x Salary)

  • Flexible working also accommodated.

About You:

  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to think quickly
  • Proven customer service skills
  • Able to build positive relationships with both customers and co-workers and work as part of a Team
  • Be able to demonstrate and communicate market leading product knowledge in the area of Mortgages
  • Excellent numeric, written and oral communication skills
  • The ability to work unsupervised and be self-motivated

  • Assess Customers suitability in relation to various Lenders criteria
  • Confidently interact with Customers and explain and advise them in relation to their Mortgage options
  • Have experience of packaging mortgage cases in an efficient and compliant manner
  • Be fully compliant with all regulatory requirements
  • Have flexibility to meet customers on & 'off-site' and virtually if and when required

Work Experience:

  • QFA or relevant industry qualifications essential or be working towards same and have full CPD Record  
  • We are happy to support continued education within the industry
job.companydescription:
We are an extremely busy Mortgage Brokers offering market based advice, with an office base in Mullingar as well as in Dublin.

We aim to deliver exceptional levels of service which exceed customer expectations and encourage our fantastic Referral based business.

We are also a Multi-Agency Intermediary offering Protection, Savings & Investment advice.

job.title: Administrative Assistant
job.description:
Company Overview:

Slix.ie is a leading provider of renewable energy solutions committed to promoting sustainability and renewable energy practices. We specialize in solar panel installations, heat pump installations, cavity wall insulation and ev chargers for residential and commercial properties, offering innovative solutions to meet our clients' energy needs.

We work, providing a wide variety of business solutions for a select group of qualified installers across Ireland to bring the customers the best possible solution. 

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly organized and efficient Administrative Assistant to join our team. The role primarily involves managing enquiries, coordinating with contractors, and overseeing administrative tasks related to invoicing and accounting software management. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess excellent computer literacy skills, and demonstrate strong communication abilities.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Handle enquiries received through the website, including responding to emails and making outbound calls to clients.

  • Organize and maintain client information in the CRM system, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of data entry.

  • Liaise with contractors to assign enquiries and coordinate project assignments according to availability and expertise.

  • Manage invoicing and accounting software, including processing payments, tracking expenses, and generating financial reports.

  • Ensure timely and accurate communication with clients and contractors regarding project status updates and scheduling.

  • Assist with general administrative tasks, such as filing, documentation, and office organization, as needed.

Requirements:

  • Previous experience in an administrative role, preferably in a high-tempo environment.

  • Strong computer literacy skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM software.

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a professional telephone manner.

  • Ability to work independently and make decisions confidently, demonstrating a proactive and solution-oriented approach.

  • Strong organisational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple deadlines effectively.

  • Commitment to achieving results and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A qualification in Business Administration or related field.

  • Familiarity with accounting software and invoicing systems.

  • Knowledge of CRM systems and experience managing client databases.

Application Instructions:

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining the Slix.ie team. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further consideration. Send applications to info@slix.ie

job.title: Electrical Team Lead
job.description:
Role/ Job Title:                 Electrical Team Lead

Reporting to:                    Engineering/ Operations Manager 

Location:                            On-Site/ Mullingar

Department:                     Operations

Primary Purpose of the Role

Overall responsibility for Electrical Build and team including personnel. 

You will be responsible for signing off on all electrical build aspects of the machines and standards.

As a team leader, you will provide guidance and instruction to the members of your team as you collectively work on a project or a portfolio of projects. You are responsible for delegating work, overseeing progress towards goals, and coaching team members as needed. Mentoring Apprenticeships & Electrical trainees. Support and guidance will be provided by senior management as requested/ necessary.

 

Qualifications:

  • Electrical Trade Qualification
  • 5+ years of experience
  • Experience with low voltage electrical systems and PLCs is advantageous.

Key Areas of Responsibility

Electrical Build

 

•                 Electrical assembly and debugging of customised automated assembly machines

•                 Marking up any changes to mechanical & electrical drawings that change during the machine build phase

•                 Electrical field wiring aspect of machine building

•                 Electrical wiring of machine control panels

•                 Managing materials related to the machine build

•                 On-site installation of equipment

•                 Meeting project delivery deadlines

•                 Quality / pre-delivery checks/ testing

•                 Implement efficient design/ layout for area

•                 Management of parts storage for WIP projects

Team Lead

•                 Management of team capacity and resource planning

•                 Management of holiday approvals and time sheets

•                 Reporting of sick days or other absence

•                 On a weekly and ongoing basis, to understand what projects are ongoing in your team and who is responsible for what project

•                 On a weekly and ongoing basis, work with team members to ensure that they are meeting the key performance indicators of the projects they are working on

•                 Oversee and manage the allocation of breaks within the team.

 

Coaching and Mentoring

·        On an ongoing basis to be the point of contact for your team members to discuss and escalate any technical issues

·        Assist team members in their ongoing development to include conducting annual performance reviews

·        Identify any training (cross-training, upskilling, formal courses etc.) which may be beneficial to team members and discuss with senior management (as part of the overall organisation training plan)

 

Communication

·        As a team leader, you will be the contact point for all team members

·        On a bi-weekly basis, recommended early Monday morning and Friday afternoon, toolbox talks should be completed with the team. A broad/ outline agenda will be provided by the Company as a support tool

·        On a weekly basis (or as required), meet with the other team leaders to discuss a range of cross-departmental issues; identify actions arising from same and take responsibility, along with your team, for closing out such actions

·        To manage and respond to email communication, both internal and external, in a timely and professional manner

Continuous Improvement

·        Undergo 5S/ LEAN training course, identify actions and implement improvements across electrical design

·        This is a longer term, project-based requirement of the role

Safety

·        To observe compliance with all company safety standards, policies and expectations on a daily basis including (but not limited to):

o   Wearing of PPE

o   Reporting of accidents, incidents, near misses

o   General housekeeping within the department

·        To address any concerns to a site safety representative

·        To maintain a continuous improvement focus

Conflict Management

·        To work collaboratively with senior management, your peers and colleagues in general to resolve issues in a timely, civil, professional and respectful manner

·        To escalate issues where they cannot be resolved locally

Company Policies, Standards & Expectations

·        To support the company in the ongoing development and achievement of professional standards and expectations, implementation of policies within the team and to report, escalate breaches/ non-conformance to the leadership team

·        To apply company policies, standards and expectations on a consistent basis across the team

Note

The above job description is non-exhaustive and is intended to be a general outline of the role, duties and responsibilities of the position. It may be added to in the future, depending on the needs of the business, customers etc.
job.category: ATIM Cluster [Custom Category], Electrician, Electronics, Engineering, Health & Safety, Installation-Maint-Repair, Management, Manufacturing, Parts Management
job.companydescription:
Robotics and Drives

We are an established, experienced team of 40 engineers providing bespoke robotics solutions to clients, large and small, across all sectors globally. We develop intelligent, elegant, tailored solutions for our bespoke client needs that are unique and innovative. Our growing team of engineers help the world’s most progressive manufacturers achieve unprecedented results.

job.title: Project Lead Role
job.description:
Project Lead Role

Robotics and Drives Irelands leading provider of bespoke robotic automation delivering Robotic solutions globally have an opportunity for an experienced Project Lead to join our growing team. The successful candidate will manage projects from initial concept through design, manufacture, and validation, including final Site Acceptance Test. You will lead a cross functional team to deliver technologically advanced and innovative projects for both domestic and international customers.

Qualifications

  • Primary Degree BSc / BEng
  • Project management qualification is an advantage.
  • 2+ years in a project engineering or project Lead role

Responsibilities

 

  • To develop, drive and achieve the project plan for a number of machines build projects.
  • Work with department leaders to develop project tasks, identify resource requirements, and set project targets and timelines.
  • Lead a cross-functional team (all departments) ensuring the phase owners are clearly identified to drive the efficient on-time achievement of set targets and milestones, within budget and subject to other key performance criteria as may be set by the Company from time to time.
  • Provide on-site leadership for project team by building and motivating team members to meet project goals, adhering to their responsibilities and project milestones.
  • Identify, manage, and support the resolution of risks and issues throughout the project, and to implement learnings as part of a continuous improvement process.
  • Day-to-day management of all project delivery matters.
  • Liaise and work effectively with internal departments ensuring that all inputs and requirements are considered.
  • Direct point of contact for customers, ensuring immediate response and reaction to items. Build long-term, sustainable relationships with our customers.
  • Constantly monitor and communicate project progress status and results to the customer as required, also communicating information from the customer to the relevant internal personnel in a timely manner.
  • Communicate on all project statuses/ project record maintenance including reporting on all project activity.
  • Reporting to management – project status, issues, risks, questions from customers, and general concerns.
  • Budget tracking – ensure project material and hours are within project budget. Identify items if they arise outside the scope of the original budget and take appropriate corrective action.
  • Forward planning in terms of resources; being able to identify gaps in a phase where upskilling can take place or where under resourcing may occur and advising management accordingly.

 

 

Key Skills & Experience

·       Experience working in a quality-controlled environment.

·       Experience working with Robotic/automation/equipment.

·        Basic understanding of PLC/pneumatic/electrical circuits

·        Proven track record in leading and managing technical projects.

  • Proactive and solutions focused with good organisational skills.
  • Ability to multitask and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent technical skills including proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint & MS Project

job.title: HR Generalist
job.description:
Who we are?

 

At Mergon, we mould ideas for a sustainable future.  We work with leading brands like Tesla, Landrover, Xerox and Abbott to design, manufacture and deliver sustainable products for the vehicles and equipment of the future.

 

We care deeply about our colleagues, customers and our community and we have a curiosity that constantly pushes us to innovate and improve.  We are competent, capable and we invest in our people and in our processes to ensure we continue to grow and do our best work every day. 

What’s the job?


We are currently looking for a HR Generalist to join our HR team in Castlepollard, Westmeath. Reporting to the HR Manager you will be responsible for supporting in the delivery of all HR operational processes from onboarding to offboarding, providing the best possible employee experience.

 

 Key responsibilities will include:

  • Support on all aspects of the HR function including but not limited to the following;
  • Act as the lead on recruitment process for indirect employee groups and supporting with recruitment process for direct
    employee group as necessary
  • Support with the employee induction phase ensuring a positive onboarding experience for all new joiners to Mergon
  • Drive performance management processes assisting and supporting Line Management / Supervisors where necessary
  • Support on grievance and disciplinary cases to satisfactory resolution
  • Management of all employee benefit programmes with external vendors
  • Management of employee engagement initiatives
  • Reporting of all HR metrics for weekly and monthly management meetings to include but not limited to; employee engagement,
    absenteeism and turnover
  • Act as an advisor to managers on employee relations issues
  • Conduct benchmarking as required
  • Act as a support to the management team in building and enhancing the culture at Mergon
  • Act as an advocate for the Mergon values and cultures in all elements of work conducted as part of the role

 

Who we’re looking for?

 

  • Proven working experience as a HR Generalist with a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience 
  • A third-level degree in HR and / or a CIPD qualification
  • Excellent knowledge of Irish employment law and HR metrics
  • Familiarity with HR systems and software
  • Competence in building and managing interpersonal relationships at all levels

 

Benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • 26 days holidays
  • Health Insurance for you and your family
  • Flexible Working Options
  • Career Growth and Development Opportunities
  • Company Gym
  • Wellness Programme
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)

Mergon is an Equal Opportunity Employer that offers flexible working arrangements and values a diverse and inclusive workplace.
job.companydescription:
Mergon is an Irish owned company with operations in Ireland,  Czech Republic, U.K., Mexico and USA.

Established in 1981 Mergon works with leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors.

It's Irish operations are based in Castlepollard in the heart of the Irish Midlands close to Mullingar. Mergon are an excellent employer in the midlands and have been very supportive of the local community over the years. Mergon have been involved in excellent health and education initiatives such as International Men’s Day, LEGO DAY , Science Week  and Mergon's School Engineering Experience. 

Mergon works with its customers to design, manufacture and assemble components that make their products succeed in their chosen markets.

In recent years the company has increased its capabilities in additive manufacturing and systems manufacturing; supplying complex moulded and electronics based assemblies to major clients like Abbott and Xerox.

As a result of working across many different sectors, Mergon has access to and experience in best practice from leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors. We believe this wealth of cross industrial experience makes us a valuable partner and gives our customers insights to ideas that typical suppliers may not have.

 

As a responsible plastic products manufacturer, Mergon constantly works to ensure that its impact on the environment meets or exceeds the expectations of both customers and the community.

Through the effective implementation of reduction, re-use and re-cycling policies and to underline our pro-active approach, Mergon was the first Technical Blow Molding company in the world to receive accreditation to the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, which provides a framework for cost-effective and environmentally sensitive manufacturing.

 

Mergon International
Water Street, Castlepollard,
Westmeath, N91 EP90, Ireland

Tel: +353 44 966 2000
Email: mergoninternational@mergon.com

job.title: Accounts Assistant
job.description:
Part-time Accounts assistant required for a busy office within a growing industry.

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate will have a role which includes:

Accounts Payable - Invoice processing & supplier reconciliations

Accounts Receivable - Sales invoicing and credit control

Actively assisting with month end processes in accordance with company deadlines & compliance requirements

Other Tasks which may arise with the office and finance department.

Key Competencies

Candidates should be :

Able to demonstrate the highest standards of professionalism and confidentiality and display a positive "can do" attitude.

A proven ability to work to strict deadlines and be able to manage multiple tasks with ease.

Demonstrate excellence in numeracy, accuracy & attention to detail.

Ability to work on own initative and work well as part of a team.

Education

- Previous experience in an accounting role

- Accounting Technician an advantage but not required

- Experience of using SAGE 50 accounts an advantage

job.title: Team Leader - FBD Insurance Mullingar
job.description:
The primary function of the Team Leader is the management of a team and the smooth running of the day to day sales and support of the operation.

Working closely with and reporting to the Sales & Performance Manager, you will be results focused and your key responsibilities will include:

  • Focus, motivate and inspire the team in a goal and results orientated way by driving optimum individual and team performance in order to deliver against agreed KPIs and targets.
  • Conducts one to one’s with team members to assess performance against objectives.
  • Carries out call evaluations on a weekly basis to ensure consistency and adherence to all regulatory requirements and best practice in customer engagement.
  • Provides leadership, support and development to members of the team and builds on the strengths of the team members that drive optimum performance.
  • Oversees and manages the day-to-day operation and workflow of the team in an organised and efficient manner.
  • Creates a learning environment to ensure that the transfer of knowledge and insight occurs.
  • Acts as a point of referral for complex and escalated queries.
  • Working closely with team colleagues to collectively achieve overall targets set
  • Ensuring all systems and procedures as laid down by the Company are complied with
  • Accruing and maintaining comprehensive up to date knowledge and information of the Company’s Personal Lines and Commercial product range and compliance requirements, and completing relevant industry qualifications as appropriate
  • Carrying out such duties as management may require from time to time

Education:

Hold a third level qualification and / or appropriate professional qualification and be APA, CIP qualified or Grandfathered in the area of selling personal and commercial insurance)

Skills:

  • Customer focused
  • Excellent negotiation, influencing & decision making skills
  • Ability to self-motivate and work on own initiative and also work as part of a team
  • Strong resilience
  • Target driven and results orientated
  • Proactive approach
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite – MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint

Competencies:

  • Excellent communication skilss (written & verbal) Commercial awareness
  • Leadership
  • Problem solving
  • Strong organisational skills
  • Meet regulatory requirements as described in the Minimum Competency Code (Source: Central Bank, 2011) and Fitness and Probity Standards (Source: Central Bank, 2012).

Please note that this role will be offered on a permanent basis.

FBD is an inclusive Equal Opportunity employer that considers applicants irrespective of their age, gender, ethnicity, culture, religion, language, sexual orientation, ability, disability and social circumstances.
job.category: Admin-Clerical, Business Development, Customer Service, Insurance, Sales
job.companydescription:
FBD Insurance has been in business for over 50 years and has grown into the largest Irish owned insurer with nearly 500,000 loyal and satisfied customers.

With local sales offices nationwide, telephone and online support, FBD's quality customer service is never more than a few steps away.

Our values represent what we believe in and what’s important to us and is at the core of our business. These are Communication, Community, Respect, Innovation, Pride and Ownership. They underpin our behaviours, informing how we go about our day.

For over 50 years FBD has been invested in agriculture, farming and rural life generally. We believe farms, businesses, consumers and wider society feel real economic and social benefits as a result of our business activities. As an organisation that plans for the future, we are mindful of our impact on Society, the Environment, and the Communities in which we operate. FBD has aligned its CSR initiatives to the UN 17 point Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) Charter to assist it focus and influence on improving the lives of our customers and wider Irish society.

Careers at FBD

Take the next step in your career and join Ireland’s largest home grown insurer. We pride ourselves in creating a dynamic working environment. We have diverse opportunities, established development paths and excellent learning opportunities to support our people.

FBD offers a competitive salary and benefits package. Some of the benefits we offer include discounted insurance products, healthcare contribution, tax save commuter tickets, pension scheme and monthly lunch allowance.

Contact

You can contact our Mullingar Call Centre on (0818 18 18 18) , lines are open from 8am -7pm (Monday to Friday) & 10am - 2pm Saturday.

FBD Insurance
Lakepoint Retail & Business Park
Mullingar
Co. Westmeath

(044) 9348867

job.title: Document Controller/Site Administrator - Construction
job.description:
Document Controller/Site Administrator

 

Our client, a major Mechanical / Electrical Engineering Services contractor are looking to hire a Document Controller/Site Administrator for their Dublin based project.

 

Job Description 

As a Document Controller/Site Administrator, you will play a pivotal role in our project development and implementation process. You will work closely with the Contracts Manager and Project Manager as well as a multidisciplinary team of engineers and industry experts to deliver cutting-edge projects. This role will be based both on-site and in office. The This position allows for a base at the Company’s project located in Dublin.

Your responsibilities will include: 

  • Providing general administrative support to the onsite team 
  • Overall Management of the project CDE (Common Data Environment) ensuring compliance.
  • Liaising with contracts managers/construction staff. 
  • Recording of daily attendance and timesheets. 
  • Filing of site report sheets, safety audits and memos. 
  • Coordination and management of the project controls. 
  • Control of critical documents via the project database. 
  • Submission and tracking of project documentation. 
  • General administration duties including data inputting and updating information efficiently. 

Skills and Requirements 

  • Leaving Certificate. 
  • 2-3 years in a similar position in the construction industry desirable.  
  • Excellent IT skills essential. 
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. 
  • Highly organised with strong attention to detail essential. 
  • Ability to multi-task and work well under strict deadlines. 
  • Experience using SAP software advantageous. 
  • Training for in-house systems will be provided to the successful candidate.
job.companydescription:
Ardale Recruitment are an established agency specialising in Construction, Engineering and the Built Environment. Having over 20yrs experience in the industry, we have developed strong and real relationships only possible through proven results and longevity. Clients include Ireland's leading employers in Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, Building Services and Main Contracting.

We are constantly on the look out for candidates in:

  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering
  • Civil, Structural & Architectural
  • Commercial, Estimating & Quantity Surveying
  • Procurement & Buying
  • Building Services Engineering

With client vacancies throughout Ireland and the UK & Europe, we can find you the ideal position to forward your career.

job.title: General Operative
job.description:
For our site in Kilbeggan we are seeking an enthusiastic  General Operative to join our well-established team and to contribute to the ongoing growth of the company. 

Responsibilities

.      Production of precast concrete products 

.      Clean the production area and machinery and equipment used. 

.      Band and lift concrete blocks.

.      Process glass to produce glass abrasives and water filtration materials.

.      Running the drying process to produce dried minerals and powders.

.      Bagging abrasives, water filtration materials, and minerals and powders.

.      General duties as instructed by the Manager and Foreman.

.      Quality control

.      Following health and safety rules

Attributes Necessary

1.      Punctuality.

2.      Ability to work on one’s own initiative.

3.      Ability to follow instruction and to work as part of a team.

4.      Good communication skills.

Qualification required.

1.      Manual handling certification.

2.      Current forklift licence.

Terms: day/Evening/night/weekend shift work. Contract duration: 9 to 12 month initial term with a view to permanency. Salary:DOE

Email cv to accounts@gannoneco.ie
job.companydescription: Gannon Eco is an award-winning company and has become one of the leading environmental solution providers, with a total reuse for industrial waste stream products in Ireland. Based in the midlands we are ideally located to serve the entire country. We specialise in reprocessing of waste materials into new products a service previous not provided in Ireland. Some of the material we reprocess are Laminated glass, Borosilicate glass, Ceramics, Aluminium oxide and Filter cake. From these materials we produce, Blast abrasives, Eco Aggregates, Fill material used in production of plastics, road markings and paint.

job.title: Home Care Assistant Longford Town
job.description:
Part-time and Full-time Home Care Assistants needed in the Longford Town area to assist clients in remaining safe and happy in their own homes. This is a fabulous opportunity to work with a company that highly values its staff. This role requires a minimum Level 5 qualification in QQI/ or level 7 in Social Care.

Successful candidates should:

  • Be fully reliable/dependable
  • Be available for evenings and weekends
  • Have the right to work in Ireland
  • Have a full clean drivers license and use of vehicle is essential
  • Be flexible and have a can-do attitude
  • Have a caring and kind disposition providing a person-centered approach to the client
  • Have a QQI- Level HealthCare Support or Equivalent QQI level 7qualification applicable to the role
  • Have at least 1 years’ experience supporting individuals with a disability/Care of the older person in a health or social care setting (desirable)
  • Specialised training within the disability sector is advantageous.

Responsibilities of the role

  • Provide high standards of emotional, social and personal care to clients in a professional manner.
  • Adhere to all of Comfort Care Ltd. policies
  • Accurate record-keeping and writing detailed reports
  • Continuous training and upskilling applicable to the role
  • Implement the client's care plan
  • Travelling to and from Clients houses to provide personal care 

 

What we offer in return:

  • Salary: €14.00-€16.00 per hour
  • Flexibility with your schedule
  • Subsidised travel
  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability
  • Carer of the month bonus
  • Opportunities to pursue qualifications in the field.
job.companydescription:
Comfort Homecare’s mission is to provide a professional, person centred care of the highest standard where clients will be treated with the greatest respect, dignity and care.

We offer a comprehensive range of home care services tailored to meet the unique needs of each client. Our services include personal care assistance, companionship, meal preparation, light housekeeping, and specialized care for individuals with specific health conditions or mobility challenges. Whether our clients require short-term assistance or long-term care, we are here to provide the compassionate support they deserve.

job.title: Home Care Assistant Rhode
job.description:
Part-time and Full-time Home Care Assistants needed in the Rhode area to assist clients in remaining safe and happy in their own homes. This is a fabulous opportunity to work with a company that highly values its staff. This role requires a minimum Level 5 qualification in QQI/ or level 7 in Social Care.

Successful candidates should:

  • Be fully reliable/dependable
  • Be available for evenings and weekends
  • Have the right to work in Ireland
  • Have a full clean drivers license and use of vehicle is essential
  • Be flexible and have a can-do attitude
  • Have a caring and kind disposition providing a person-centered approach to the client
  • Have a QQI- Level HealthCare Support or Equivalent QQI level 7qualification applicable to the role
  • Have at least 1 years’ experience supporting individuals with a disability/Care of the older person in a health or social care setting (desirable)
  • Specialised training within the disability sector is advantageous.

Responsibilities of the role

  • Provide high standards of emotional, social and personal care to clients in a professional manner.
  • Adhere to all of Comfort Care Ltd. policies
  • Accurate record-keeping and writing detailed reports
  • Continuous training and upskilling applicable to the role
  • Implement the client's care plan
  • Travelling to and from Clients houses to provide personal care 

 

What we offer in return:

  • Salary: €14.00-€16.00 per hour
  • Flexibility with your schedule
  • Subsidised travel
  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability
  • Carer of the month bonus
  • Opportunities to pursue qualifications in the field.
job.companydescription:
Comfort Homecare’s mission is to provide a professional, person centred care of the highest standard where clients will be treated with the greatest respect, dignity and care.

We offer a comprehensive range of home care services tailored to meet the unique needs of each client. Our services include personal care assistance, companionship, meal preparation, light housekeeping, and specialized care for individuals with specific health conditions or mobility challenges. Whether our clients require short-term assistance or long-term care, we are here to provide the compassionate support they deserve.
