job.title: Machine Operative
job.description:
KC Sports have an opening for a Machine Operative to join the production team in Mullingar. This would suit a person with a keen interest in the clothing and sportswear industry

KC Sports offers bespoke and unique products, crafting each garment individually to customer specifications, allowing for custom variations like initials, crests, sponsors, colorways, and more. Their custom production facility in Mullingar, along with an in-house design, production, warehouse, customer service, and sales team, supports customers, clubs, and online stores throughout Ireland. KCS is a licenced Official GAA; LGFA and Camogie apparel supplier..

Experience is not essential and full training will be given, however, a interest in sewing or embroidery would be useful.

This is a full time position and we are interested in Irish/EU applicants currently living in or close to Mullingar.
job.category: General Labor, Ladies' Fashion, Men's Fashion, Sports
job.companydescription:
KCS stands as a prominent specialist in team apparel within Ireland, catering to schools, clubs, and universities.

Having been established in 1996, we take immense pride in our position as one of the primary licensed suppliers of official GAA, LGFA, and Camogie attire across the country with dedicated shops for over 120 sports clubs.

Our primary objective revolves around the creation and delivery of top-tier sports and leisurewear, achieved through a blend of innovation, fabric curation, and design excellence, all accompanied by exceptional customer service.

Bespoke and Unique

At the core of our offerings lies the concept of customization, enabling the production of truly distinctive items. Each garment is meticulously crafted to adhere to the customer's specifications, allowing for unique variations tailored to various occasions, be it an event, championship, final, presentation, or any other scenario. Personalized elements such as initials, crests, sponsors, color schemes, and a plethora of creative ideas can be seamlessly incorporated.

Our state-of-the-art production facility, situated in Mullingar, is dedicated to the construction of custom-made pieces. Complementing this, our central office, co-located on the same premises, boasts an in-house design unit, production team, warehousing capabilities, as well as a customer service and sales team. This integrated setup ensures unwavering support for our valued customers, clubs, and online stores.

job.title: Tooling Engineer
job.description:
At Mergon, we mould ideas for a sustainable future. We work with leading brands like Tesla, BMW, Xerox and Abbott to design, manufacture and deliver sustainable products for the vehicles and equipment of the future.

We care deeply about our colleagues, customers and our community and we have a curiosity that constantly pushes us to innovate and improve. We are competent, capable and we invest in our people and in our processes to ensure we continue to grow and do our best work every day.

Due to the ongoing growth of activity in the area of new projects, we are currently looking to add a Tooling Engineer to our Global New Programmes Team. The Tooling Engineer will work closely with our prestigious customers such as Tesla, Toyota, Xerox and JLR to design and develop moulds for products of the future.

This is a full-time, permanent role with a 40 hour working week. 

Key responsibilities:

  • Creation of design for manufacture or part feasibility reports for customer feedback and agreement of part design with customer
  • Selection of tooling vendors for projects
  • Agreement of mould design with internal cross functional team
  • Review and approval of mould and tooling CAD to optimise manufacturing efficiency and product quality.
  • Overall management of the performance of all tooling suppliers and reporting on project status at progress reviews internally and with customer.
  • Selection and development of new tooling vendors.
  • Co-ordination of all trials at supplier site and in house as relevant and sign off on moulds.

To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • A portfolio of previous work as a Tooling Engineer
  • Experience with CAD and AutoCAD software
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills
  • A good eye for detail and design
  • Leadership and communication skills
  • The ability to work independently and in a team
  • The ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

This is an exciting opportunity to work as part of an experienced global team with world class customers.

Benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • 26 days holidays
  • Health Insurance for you and your family
  • Flexible Working Options
  • Career Growth and Development Opportunities
  • Company Gym
  • Wellness Programme
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)

Mergon is an Equal Opportunity Employer that offers flexible working arrangements and values a diverse and inclusive workplace.
job.companydescription:
Mergon is an Irish owned company with operations in Ireland,  Czech Republic, U.K., Mexico and USA.

Established in 1981 Mergon works with leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors.

It's Irish operations are based in Castlepollard in the heart of the Irish Midlands close to Mullingar. Mergon are an excellent employer in the midlands and have been very supportive of the local community over the years. Mergon have been involved in excellent health and education initiatives such as International Men’s Day, LEGO DAY , Science Week  and Mergon's School Engineering Experience. 

Mergon works with its customers to design, manufacture and assemble components that make their products succeed in their chosen markets.

In recent years the company has increased its capabilities in additive manufacturing and systems manufacturing; supplying complex moulded and electronics based assemblies to major clients like Abbott and Xerox.

As a result of working across many different sectors, Mergon has access to and experience in best practice from leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors. We believe this wealth of cross industrial experience makes us a valuable partner and gives our customers insights to ideas that typical suppliers may not have.

 

As a responsible plastic products manufacturer, Mergon constantly works to ensure that its impact on the environment meets or exceeds the expectations of both customers and the community.

Through the effective implementation of reduction, re-use and re-cycling policies and to underline our pro-active approach, Mergon was the first Technical Blow Molding company in the world to receive accreditation to the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, which provides a framework for cost-effective and environmentally sensitive manufacturing.

 

Mergon International
Water Street, Castlepollard,
Westmeath, N91 EP90, Ireland

Tel: +353 44 966 2000
Email: mergoninternational@mergon.com

job.title: Handyman/Gardener Required
job.description:
Handyman/Gardner required for busy stud farm.

Property Maintenance experience helpful

Experience with Garden/Farm Machinery helpful. 

Monday to Friday 8am to 5pm
job.companydescription:
Gigginstown House Angus

Since the herd was established in 1997, Gigginstown House is committed to investing in top-tier genetics. Initially incorporating Canadian show champions from Edmonton and Regina, we have expanded our genetic pool with the finest specimens from Ireland and Britain. The Gigginstown herd has achieved acclaim at both the Spring Show and National Shows.

Our focus on quality is evident in our selection of top heifers from Canada, Ireland, and Scotland, chosen for their conformation, functionality, and maternal traits. These heifers include offspring from Angus legends like Krugerrand, Stockman 365, TC Stockman, Extra Gold, Green’s Premium, and Black Magic, complemented by champion Irish and UK Heifers.

As of 2022, our herd comprises over 450 cows and breeding heifers, contributing to the next generation of champions. Emphasizing quality breeding, we've acquired outstanding head sires, importing champion bulls directly from Canada and bringing Perth champions from Scotland. These sires, alongside others in our herd, consistently produce high-quality males and females for elite pedigree and commercial herds in Ireland and the UK.

Our bulls, aged between 16 to 24 months, are well-developed, easy calving, and provide out-cross genetics to enhance both pedigree and commercial breeding programs.

Our commitment to quality is underscored by our herd's negative testing for BVD, vaccination against Black leg, BVD, IBR, and Lepto, and dams testing free of Johne’s disease. All animals are sold with a breeding guarantee, and bulls undergo fertility testing before sale. Managed by Joe O’Mahony and his team, the Gigginstown Angus sale welcomes you to our auctions, and we express gratitude for your support. For quality Angus animals throughout the year, feel free to contact us.

job.title: Home Care Assistant (Holiday Cover)
job.description:
AllPro Recruitment, on behalf of our public sector client, have an immediate requirement for a Home Care Assistant for holiday cover in the Longford area, as part of the home help team.

This role is for 15-20 hours per week, contract length is roughly 5 weeks.

Flexibility around working hours essential.

Requirements:

  • Fluent written and spoken English
  • Full QQI Level 5 (or above) major award in Healthcare (must include Care Skills, Care of the Elderly and communication modules)
  • Previous caring experience
  • Full Driver’s License
  • Adaptability and flexibility
  • Good communication skills
  • Willingness to work support calls of varying lengths

Send your CV to AllPro Recruitment today or contact our office for more information.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: €16.01 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Work Location: In person
job.companydescription:
Allpro Recruitment is a multi-award winning boutique recruitment agency with Midlands and Dublin branches.

We specialise in recruiting for Office Support, HR, Sales and Marketing, Finance, IT & Engineering, Construction, Warehouse & Manufacturing, Healthcare, Pharma and Public Jobs.

job.title: Service Engineer
job.description:
On behalf of our client, leaders in fitting and maintaining swimming pools nationwide, we are now hiring for a full-time service engineer to work in the midlands region. The weekly hours are between Monday and Friday. The role involves the installation, testing and inspection of mechanical/electrical services. in various pools around the area.

Electrical or mechanical experience is essential for this role. Past experience in this line of work is desirable but full training will be provided to the successful candidate. The candidate must have strong attention to detail, ability to work on own initiative and to work to tight deadlines. This role offers a competitive salary together with company vehicle and phone.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: €50,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
job.companydescription:

job.description:

job.title: Survey Technician (No previous experience required)
job.description:
IDASO is a data collection company who use the latest technologies to gather information on traffic patterns to be used by transport planners, consulting engineers and local authorities. As part of our current expansion plan we are hiring drivers to install survey equipment. No previous experience required as all training will be provided.

Summary of Position

The role involves navigating around Ireland and sometimes the UK in a company vehicle. You would be learning to install various pieces of the latest technology and equipment to monitor the movements of traffic flows and pedestrians alongside our experienced data capture team. The role requires evening and night work therefore experience in this type of working is highly desired.

Good communication skills, enthusiasm for high quality and an interest in outdoor work is essential for this type of role.

Position Requirements

  • Working evenings and nights
  • Where necessary deal with clients and the public in a sensitive and professional manner
  • Have a good attention to detail and be able to understand and follow company procedures
  • Have a good driving record and possess a full Irish Driving Licence
  • Be a safe driver and very aware of other road users
  • Be able to work alone and unsupervised or as part of a team
job.category: Construction, Engineering, Entry Level, Research, Transportation
job.companydescription:
IDASO specialises in providing traffic, transport and mobility data for use in Strategic Planning, Traffic Impact Assessments, Property Management and Retail Assessments, along with optimisation of existing transport management systems.

Based in the centre of Ireland at the National Science Park, IDASO offers services and software solutions to clients worldwide from Maynooth to Malaysia.

IDASO is a data collection company who use the latest technologies to gather information on traffic patterns to be used by transport planners, consulting engineers and local authorities.

job.title: Junior Legal Secretary
job.description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

As a long-established legal practice in Mullingar town, Nooney & Dowdall has a lot to offer an up-and-coming ambitious Junior Legal Secretary.

This role requires a combination of professional accuracy, but also highly developed people skills, with the ability to relate to a wide variety of interesting customers.

Our office combines the professionalism as required by the legal sector – yet the personability expected in a provincial town, giving you, the best of both worlds.

 

Required

  • Secretarial course completion necessary
  • Good digital skills – with the use of MS 365
  • Good typing speeds
  • Attention to detail / accuracy vital.

 

With our offices located close to the bustling Town Centre of Mullingar’s there’s no shortage of local lunch, shopping, sports and entertainment venues for candidates looking for a more affordable alternative to Dublin.
job.category: Admin-Clerical, Customer Service, Digital, Legal, Secretary
job.companydescription:
SERVING CLIENTS SINCE 1877

Nooney & Dowdall Solicitors LLP was founded in 1877 and in the course of the following century established a reputation for providing personal service and professional advice which the present partners and staff endeavour to maintain and enhance.

While based in Mullingar, County Westmeath, we serve clients throughout Ireland and in many and diverse parts of the world. We see as our primary objective the provision of a personal professional service to our individual clients and to the officers of our corporate clients. Many clients consult us at times of great stress. We aim to make visits to our offices a pleasant experience. Our goal is to provide the finest service possible for our clients.

We engage Pearts Solicitors, Upper Ormond Quay, Dublin 7 as our town agents and we also consult with Ivan Barry of Prince Evans Solicitors who from their base in West London practise in London, the South East, and English Midlands.

job.title: Instrumentation Field Operations Team Lead
job.description:
Role overview

Our client, a global leader in measurement instrumentation, services and solutions for the Pharma, Life Sciences, Water/Wastewater and Food & Beverage sectors are looking to hire an Instrumentation Field Operations Team Lead.

The role can be based in either Cork or Kildare.

Job Purpose     

The role will entail reporting to the Service Manager, leading a team of Field Service Engineers, managing the day-to-day activity, and working closely with the Service Coordinator and Technical Coordinator to ensure excellence in customer service.

Experience & Skills Required

  • The ideal candidate will have experience managing a team and managing the associated people processes, however, a proven aptitude for managing relationships, providing feedback, taking the lead and making decisions, will also be considered for this role.
  • Degree, Diploma or time served in the field of Process Instrumentation & Control or in an associated technical background.
  • Relevant experience in industrial measurement in Life Science / Pharma, Food & Beverage or Water / Wastewater Industries.
  • Experience as a Service Technician / Engineer in a process instrumentation / control environment with a particular emphasis on commissioning / start-up and troubleshooting would be viewed as a major asset.
  • Solutions focused with a proven track record for innovation and initiative when engaging with customers.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and bring others along the journey.
  • Full, clean, driving license.
  • Good working knowledge of MS Windows, MS Excel, MS Word, Outlook.
  • Willingness to travel to customer sites and to be flexible around working hours.
  • Excellent communication skills: clear and effective written and spoken communication ability.

** Full job description provided upon application
job.companydescription:
Ardale Recruitment are an established agency specialising in Construction, Engineering and the Built Environment. Having over 20yrs experience in the industry, we have developed strong and real relationships only possible through proven results and longevity. Clients include Ireland's leading employers in Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, Building Services and Main Contracting.

We are constantly on the look out for candidates in:

  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering
  • Civil, Structural & Architectural
  • Commercial, Estimating & Quantity Surveying
  • Procurement & Buying
  • Building Services Engineering

With client vacancies throughout Ireland and the UK & Europe, we can find you the ideal position to forward your career.
